nodes.bodyText:
I would prefer if we could stick to the four spaces convention.
It's not consistent across all the source code but most of our pom files are this way.

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't the version be in the BOM? Or there's a good reason to have them here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,131 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+  <parent>
+    <artifactId>quarkus-grpc-parent</artifactId>
+    <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+    <version>999-SNAPSHOT</version>
+    <relativePath>../</relativePath>
+  </parent>
+
+  <artifactId>quarkus-grpc-codegen</artifactId>
+  <name>Quarkus - gRPC - Code Gen</name>
+
+  <dependencies>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+      <artifactId>quarkus-core-deployment</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+      <artifactId>quarkus-devtools-utilities</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>com.google.protobuf</groupId>
+      <artifactId>protoc</artifactId>
+      <classifier>linux-aarch_64</classifier>
+      <type>exe</type>
+      <version>${protoc.version}</version>

nodes.bodyText:
If I remember correctly, the only reason was that there is a lot of them.
If you think it's okay to have them all in the BOM, I'll move them.

nodes.bodyText: spaces will work as is on Windows and macOS?

I don't know, I don't really have a way to check.
@rsvoboda reported that it doesn't work on linux

To shed some more light on it, the paths are passed as separate arguments in the ProcessBuilder's command, so they should be okay without backslashes before spaces. It's protoc that doesn't handle them properly on Linux. I don't know about other systems.
Maybe @cescoffier can check on macOS if you can put together a test case?
@cescoffier checked and this version (without \ before spaces) worked for him on Mac
Same here about the 4 spaces convention.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -308,3 +254,88 @@ Then, open http://localhost:8080/hello/quarkus in a browser, and you should get
 
 Like any other Quarkus applications, you can package it with: `mvn package`.
 You can also package the application into a native executable with: `mvn package -Pnative`.
+
+== Generating Java files from proto with protobuf-maven-plugin
+
+Alternatively to using Quarkus code generation to generate stubs for `proto` files, you can also use
+`protobuf-maven-plugin` for this purpose.
+To do it, edit the `pom.xml` file to add the quarkus gRPC extension dependency and the JSR 305 (just under `<dependencies>`):

nodes.bodyText:
I only moved the section in the original commit, it seems it was a bit outdated.
I removed JSR305 and did some further fixes to the docs.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -308,3 +254,88 @@ Then, open http://localhost:8080/hello/quarkus in a browser, and you should get
 
 Like any other Quarkus applications, you can package it with: `mvn package`.
 You can also package the application into a native executable with: `mvn package -Pnative`.
+
+== Generating Java files from proto with protobuf-maven-plugin
+
+Alternatively to using Quarkus code generation to generate stubs for `proto` files, you can also use
+`protobuf-maven-plugin` for this purpose.
+To do it, edit the `pom.xml` file to add the quarkus gRPC extension dependency and the JSR 305 (just under `<dependencies>`):
